task.title: Installing the spdf4 plugin
task.shortdesc: How to install the spdf4 plugin.

prereq.p: Before installing the plugin, you must download, install, configure, and test the DITA Open Toolkit. The spdf4 plugin has been tested with versions 1.5.4 and 1.6.1. You can find details about the DITA Open Toolkit at sourceforge.net.

step.cmd: Copy the spdf4 plugin folder (com.kpe.spdf4) to the plugins folder in the DITA Open Toolkit.
Run the integrator to add the plugin to the DITA Open Toolkit.

substep.cmd: Run the file startcmd.bat or startcmd.sh to open a command window.

stepresult.p: After just a second or two, you should see something similar to this:
stepresult.codeblock:
bash-3.2$ ant -f integrator.xml Buildfile: integrator.xml
integrate:
BUILD SUCCESSFUL Total time: 0 seconds bash-3.2$

info.p: There are a variety of ways to run the plugin, but the most basic is again from the command line:ant -f build.xml -Dargs.input=inputfile.ditamap -Doutput.dir=/test -Dtranstype=spdf4 -Dpdf-formatter=ah|fop|xep

note.p: The command line is split here for readability, but you should put the entire command on one line with no carriage returns.
The various items shown in italics need to replaced with your specific file names and directory paths.
